name: Chateau Tongariro Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2014, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very much looked forward to staying at the CT but the overall upkeep and cleanliness really took alot away from this grand old hotel. This place really needs a major upgrade wit its interiors. It has so much potential and is a little sad to see it this condition. The room is not worth the $195 for a std room as very dated, small and the bed very uncomfortable. The Staff are great especially in the Restaurant and are quite some characters. The food is actually quite good and made up for the dull and dusty room. Wouldn't stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location but poor hotel
Impressive building.......set in wilderness
reviews.text: You had to be impressed by the size and scale of this hotel, set in national park. Everything was quite staid and old fashioned,.....ready for refurbishment, but despite this the staff and service were both very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited on a quite day/ period so found everything very relaxed and able to see view experience the Whakapapa centre easily. Extremely professional help and assistance for anyone wishing to take one of many walks.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay in a grand setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights and overall we had a very pleasant stay. The hotel is a grand lady with high ceilings, massive picture windows over the views, and an old style charm.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

reviews.text: Unfortunately the hotel made a real meal of our booking. We went for the Tongariro Crossing trek package and added one extra night B+B. We got there eventually but at one point I was communicating with 3 people and 3 different levels of service. It didn't help that they did not know what the trek package contained. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a suite (possibly because of our booking experience).
reviews.title: Old Charm

reviews.text: We spent one night at the Chateau which was organised by our friends. They booked the Celebration package which included a 3 course dinner and full breakfast. Our rooms were superb and ours had views of a snow capped mountain. We had a spa in our room which was in the new wing. The lounge overlooked 2 other snow capped mountains and the room was classic and very classy. They had a pianist playing while we sipped our champagne (also provided in the package) as we looked out at the mountains. Our dinner was the finest and the service exceptionally good. Breakfast was equally good and we left feeling utterly pampered and spoilt!
reviews.title: Spoilt rotten!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Careful what you book. If it says in the fine prints that you will stay at the Fergusson motel, you'll stay behind Chateau Tongariro in a small group of motel suites. As the fine prints in your confirmation e-mail say: this is NOT the standard of the Chateau main building and you are staying in a 2 star motel. Hence the price you paid. You are however allowed to visit the main hotel (lobby, dining etc.).
reviews.title: Fergusson motel: not the Chateau you expected

reviews.text: On the Plus side: very spacious suite. Has a washer and dryer + kitchenette. Very warm and strong shower.
reviews.title: Good service but its Gloomy and Tired

reviews.text: On the Minus side: no light outside, so make sure you arrive before sunset. And parking at the back is tight if there is more than one car. Quite a few bugs in the apartment. No wifi whatsoever. Maid did change half of the towels, but ran away with the other half and the soap while leaving in place the bugs we smashed. One lamp in the bedroom was not working. No actual dresser for clothes. Lots of condensation in bathroom after a shower. Overall, the whole motel looks old and poor quality. Really needs freshening up.
reviews.title: Beautiful graceful ambiance

reviews.text: I stayed for two nights at the Chateau either side of a spell of long distance walking.
reviews.title: Exceptional views

reviews.text: We stayed in the hotel's Motel wing for 2 nights in November to do the Tongariro Alpine Crossing. The wonderful location was just below Mt Ruapehu. We have the access to all the facilities Chateau. Staffs were very helpful, friendly and courteous. Arranged the lunch bags and transportation for our hiking. The hotel had very few guests when were there. So it was really really great to walk around the hotel with such tranquil peace. We loved the old world atmosphere, felt like in the movie set. The view from the lounge on the mountain just superb. Parking was easy on the motel side, each unit has a space. 2 bedroom unit was very nice with fully equipped kitchen, washer and dryer, Flat screen tv, heaters, and a little porch. The price is 2 star motel, but actually is more like a 4 stars to us. We enjoyed everything about this Chateau and the Whakapapa village and The Crossing! The most amazing place to stay!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed here many years ago and returned to support friends competing in "The Goat" over the weekend.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting but ....
Strange place to find in the middle of nowhere
reviews.text: Rainy setting on arrival and it really did look like an opening scene from "The Shining" but there were more positives than negatives.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Old fashioned hotel with good reputation.
reviews.title: Magnificent setting

reviews.text: Check in was basic but efficient. Rabbit warren of rooms with our group distributed in a range of room types.
reviews.title: Old charming place but run down
4 Star Building, 2/3 Star Service
reviews.text: Having made two separate bookings of two "superior rooms", in August for two stays in December I was disappointed by the following;

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the first stay the rooms were three floors apart, musty (which can be expected for an old building) and certainly not "superior".
reviews.title: High Tea was Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No air conditioning which is odd for a 4 star hotel but perhaps part of the "feel of the beautiful old chateau". Upon opening a window the rooms promptly filled with blow flies, apparently fly screens like air conditioning would affect the "feel" of the chateau.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the second stay, early check in was unavailable, however in the six hours between us popping in and the official check in time staff made no effort to prioritise the two rooms preparation. Upon the 3pm check in there was a 40 minute delay for a room. Instead of offering tea/coffee/water/internet during the delay, staff said "only one room is ready please wait there" and promptly avoided eye contact."
reviews.title: A chateau with a view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both rooms this time contained blowflies before we opened the windows.
reviews.title: Strange and Unusual

aka: Bayview Chateau Tongariro Hotel Tongariro National Park
description: Everything we do at the Chateau Tongariro Hotel we believe in providing you with a timeless elegance. We believe that preserving tradition and history is most important and as the hotel is located within a dual World Heritage National Park, conservation and culture are also at the forefront of your experience. Tongariro National Park provides a stunning natural playground bursting with diverse landscapes for visitors to the Chateau Tongariro to discover. Chateau Tongariro provides accommodation, restaurants, bars and conference facilities and is an all-seasons, utterly timeless experience not to be missed.
